snippet: A judge has rejected the federal government’s effort to dismiss a lawsuit over the constitutionality of the no-fly list on the grounds that the lawsuit would expose state secrets.
abstract: Virginia Judge Anthony Trenga rejects federal government’s effort to dismiss a lawsuit over the constitutionality of federal no-fly list on grounds that suit would expose state secrets; suit was filed by Gulet Mohamed after his apparent placement on list left him detained by Kuwaiti authorities.
lead_paragraph: A judge has rejected the federal government’s effort to dismiss a lawsuit over the constitutionality of the no-fly list on the grounds that the lawsuit would expose state secrets.

headline.main: Virginia: No-Fly Lawsuit Allowed to Proceed
headline.print_headline: Virginia: No-Fly Lawsuit Allowed to Proceed
